{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3187737,"name":"Orion DeYoe","username":"Orion.DeYoe","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/orion.deyoe/{size}/171961_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-12T15:49:35.923Z","cooked":"

3005 is pleased to release the CAD of our robot this year:

image603×737 109 KB

https://cad.onshape.com/documents/230339548ba1828471e00cef/w/7608c62ea34bc84ee4acccd[…]ec5e1812bae3918?renderMode=0&uiState=6436b79f99bcb7580ba64f8e

We’ve received a lot of questions about our robot and we think making the CAD public is a fun way to showcase our design to teams around the world. For teams or individuals attending the championship next week, feel free to stop by the pit and ask questions.

This is a snapshot of the current working CAD model so there are plenty of broken things in the model or things that don’t match the actual robot. I think this is a good representation of what a well-organized but practical FRC CAD model can look like.

The 3D prints are all almost exclusively PLA or PLA+. There are a very small number of markforged onyx prints where it matters like supporting the e-chain on the telescoping part of the arm.

How is the arm gearbox supported? And what’s the thinking for mounting it that way rather than a more conventional rigid mount?

I have GOT to check this robot out at the championship!

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-04-13T14:54:33.334Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":490,"readers_count":489,"score":138.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":434083,"topic_slug":"3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16805,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023/434083/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3188728,"name":"Eric Leifermann","username":"EricLeifermann","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ericleifermann/{size}/132793_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-13T14:58:40.940Z","cooked":"

The gearbox plates react off the aluminum cross tube at the base of the tower. Then there are 2 turnbuckles that we use to tension the chain.

image1083×1046 119 KB

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-04-13T14:58:40.940Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":29,"reads":469,"readers_count":468,"score":528.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":434083,"topic_slug":"3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023","display_username":"Eric Leifermann","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/9/4/94d86ae25271d48cc01b1799ec3a612907af3163.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16805,"username":"Kevin_Leonard","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kevin_leonard/{size}/237299_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":17}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023/434083/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":17},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":22,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3188733,"name":"Steven Smith","username":"Steven_Smith","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/8e8cbc/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-13T15:01:57.295Z","cooked":"

As far as the “why” side versus a rigid mount, this ended up being a little easier. We wanted the cross member for structural support anyway. We knew chain tension would be something we’d need to tweak (lot of force with how fast the arm moves). It also gives us a little side to side play to adjust for tracking. The mount to the cross member is just a slip fit, with collars to hold it in place axially along that tube.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-04-13T15:03:06.862Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":442,"readers_count":441,"score":168.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":434083,"topic_slug":"3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023","display_username":"Steven Smith","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16805,"username":"Kevin_Leonard","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kevin_leonard/{size}/237299_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20818,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023/434083/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3188738,"name":"Nick Aarestad","username":"cadandcookies","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cadandcookies/{size}/158154_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-13T15:03:48.002Z","cooked":"

Spent a bunch of time looking through this model last night— so many cute details between the tension members, the chain tensioning system, the intake/rotational wrist, wire routing, the linear extension gearbox built into the sprocket… there’s a ton here for anyone to learn something new.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-04-13T15:04:19.327Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":423,"readers_count":422,"score":134.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":434083,"topic_slug":"3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023","display_username":"Nick Aarestad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023/434083/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3188744,"name":"","username":"Kevin_Leonard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kevin_leonard/{size}/237299_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-13T15:06:27.895Z","cooked":"
EricLeifermann:

Then there are 2 turnbuckles that we use to tension the chain.

So you essentially tension the chain by moving the gearbox?

Steven_Smith:

It also gives us a little side to side play to adjust for tracking. The mount to the cross member is just a slip fit, with collars to hold it in place axially along that tube.

Really cool engineering here. Would not have occurred to me to just let the gearbox slip fit around the cross-tube and give it rigidity with the turnbuckles.

cadandcookies:

the linear extension gearbox built into the sprocket

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-04-13T15:06:27.895Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":3,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":421,"readers_count":420,"score":109.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":434083,"topic_slug":"3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16805,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023/434083/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3188778,"name":"Orion DeYoe","username":"Orion.DeYoe","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/orion.deyoe/{size}/171961_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-13T15:29:47.092Z","cooked":"

Yep, the whole gearbox pivots around the round tube.

This is a little trick pulled from the heavy equipment industry where this is a pretty common way of belt tensioning.

The advantage is that it’s a lot easier to keep the shafts parallel while making the adjustment. As opposed to some sort of linear adjustment, The other main advantage is rotational motion is typically simpler with lower part count and simpler parts in general.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-04-13T15:29:47.092Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":378,"readers_count":377,"score":405.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":434083,"topic_slug":"3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023","display_username":"Orion DeYoe","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16805,"username":"Kevin_Leonard","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kevin_leonard/{size}/237299_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":17}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18343,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3005"},"post_url":"/t/3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023/434083/10","custom_user_title":"FRC 3005","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":16},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":19,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3189133,"name":"Mack","username":"Michael_Kaurich","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/michael_kaurich/{size}/6292_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-13T20:28:34.063Z","cooked":"

Do you need to do any modifications to the
Slide-Snap latches - 1872A111 to get them to work with #10? I haven’t used these before but this is a much more elegant solution to the bumper mounting issue that caused us some issues this season.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-04-13T20:28:34.063Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":322,"readers_count":321,"score":84.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":434083,"topic_slug":"3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023","display_username":"Mack","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.mcmaster.com/1872A111","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"McMaster-Carr","clicks":34},{"url":"/tag/10","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18942,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Have you tried turning it off and back on again?"},"post_url":"/t/3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023/434083/11","custom_user_title":"Have you tried turning it off and back on again?","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3189168,"name":"Jacob","username":"suaec","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/suaec/{size}/180705_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-13T20:45:14.025Z","cooked":"

Most likely the chain generator featurescript. CD Link

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-04-13T20:45:14.025Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":316,"readers_count":315,"score":108.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":434083,"topic_slug":"3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023","display_username":"Jacob","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/pic-chain-path-featurescript/161169","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"pic: Chain Path Featurescript","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52983,"username":"quinnlindsey","name":"Quinn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/q/838e76/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35781,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3005-robochargers-cad-release-2023/434083/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3190135,"name":"Adrian","username":"AutumnCast","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/autumncast/{size}/242296_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-14T17:53:36.702Z","cooked":"

We drill out the bushings to use #10-32 bolts to mount to the frame. You could use smaller sizes, but keeping bolt sizes to a smaller selection makes it easier for the pit crew. For the bumper side brackets, we use M3 hardware.
Also, we buy them from here to save some money over McMaster
Red: bumper side brackets, M3
Blue: frame side, drilled #10-32
